VRLayerInit.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The VRLayerInit dictionary of the WebVR API represents a content layer (an or ) that you want to present in a VR display.

blockquote.para: This dictionary was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: You can retrieve VRLayerInit objects using , and present them using the method.

VRLayerInitRightBounds.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The rightBounds property of the interface (dictionary) defines the right texture bounds of the canvas whose contents will be presented by the .

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRLayerInitRightBounds.value: An array of four floating point values, which can take values from 0.0–1.0:If leftBounds is not specified in the dictionary, the default value used is [0.5, 0.0, 0.5, 1.0].

VRLayerInitSource.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The source property of the interface (dictionary) defines the canvas whose contents will be presented by the .

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRLayerInitLeftBounds.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The leftBounds property of the interface (dictionary) defines the left texture bounds of the canvas whose contents will be presented by the .

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRLayerInitLeftBounds.value: An array of four floating point values, which can take values from 0.0–1.0.If leftBounds is not specified in the dictionary, the default value used is [0.0, 0.0, 0.5, 1.0].
